intro: Echinospermum laevigatum, commonly known as the smooth echinocephalum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its seeds are enclosed in a spiny, spherical capsule, which is typical of the genus Echinospermum. This species is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
